codes.verbatim_quote: quello che faccio è andare al catalogo
codes.context: User immediately navigates to catalog section to begin searching for journal article to edit

codes.verbatim_quote: qui vedo che ho le issue come prima schermata, vado su journal article
codes.context: User notices catalog displays issues by default and navigates to journal article tab to find target resource

codes.verbatim_quote: Qui mi aspetterei di trovare una barra di ricerca, onestamente
codes.context: Task 1: User explicitly expects to find a search bar in catalog view to locate specific journal article

codes.verbatim_quote: uno scorro lo trovo qua, altrimenti avrei fatto un comando F
codes.context: Task 1: User scrolls through list to find article, mentions would have used browser's Ctrl+F if scrolling didn't work

codes.verbatim_quote: Quindi dobbiamo modificare la risorsa e aggiungere un autore
codes.context: User quickly understands task requirement after accessing target journal article page

codes.verbatim_quote: un autore che ha questo nome, questo nome. Lo aggiungiamo così
codes.context: Task 1: User creates new author entity directly by entering given name and family name

codes.verbatim_quote: altrimenti usiamo gli altri campi. La creiamo e aggiungiamo anche l'identificativo che è un ORCID con questo valore
codes.context: Task 1: User recognizes need to add ORCID identifier to author entity after creating it

codes.verbatim_quote: Esiste già, lo aggiungiamo
codes.context: Task 1: System detects existing author entity matching the ORCID identifier provided

codes.verbatim_quote: la spostiamo come primo autore
codes.context: Task 1: User successfully uses reordering functionality to move Caroline Scagel to first author position

codes.verbatim_quote: Salviamo, confermiamo. Ok, controllo e perfetto, ci risulta all'inizio
codes.context: Task 1: User saves changes, verifies Caroline Scagel appears as first author in updated record

codes.verbatim_quote: andiamo a visitare la pagina dell'autore, ci sono delle similar resources
codes.context: Task 2: User accesses Richard Carew's author page and immediately identifies similar resources notification

codes.verbatim_quote: quindi andiamo su merge
codes.context: Task 2: User immediately proceeds to merge functionality upon detecting duplicate author entities

codes.verbatim_quote: qua cliccherei su merge into ma non ho feedback
codes.context: Task 2: User attempts to click directional arrow in merge interface, mistaking it for the 'merge into' button due to semantic inconsistency - the arrow has same visual characteristics (color, style) as interactive buttons despite being non-interactive graphic element

codes.verbatim_quote: Controllo che ce ne siano altri e procedo anche con questo merge
codes.context: Task 2: After first merge, user checks for additional duplicates and systematically merges them

codes.verbatim_quote: non ci sono delle informazioni differenti, per cui confermo e procedo
codes.context: Task 2: User reviews duplicate entities before merging to verify no unique information would be lost

codes.verbatim_quote: La quarta task riguarda aggiungere questo journal article nel repository, quindi vado su new record, è un journal article
codes.context: Task 4: User confidently approaches new publication creation by navigating to new record and selecting journal article type

codes.verbatim_quote: literal value con questo DOI
codes.context: Task 4: User correctly identifies DOI as primary identifier for journal article and enters it as literal value

codes.verbatim_quote: poi il titolo, gli autori: Massari, Arcangelo, Peroni, Silvio, non c'è, li aggiungiamo
codes.context: Task 4: User methodically enters metadata fields in sequence: identifier, title, authors with given and family names

codes.verbatim_quote: Entrambi hanno sicuramente un identificativo, ed è questo per Massari, questo per Peroni
codes.context: Task 4: User confidently adds ORCID identifiers for both authors without hesitation

codes.verbatim_quote: Poi ci interessa il publisher e lo creiamo
codes.context: Task 4: User creates new publisher entity as part of journal article metadata completion

codes.verbatim_quote: ci interessano le pagine 317 e 340
codes.context: Task 4: User enters start and end page numbers for journal article

codes.verbatim_quote: ci interessa l'issue che è 20 e volume 9
codes.context: Task 4: User enters issue and volume numbers for journal article metadata

codes.verbatim_quote: Ho un suggerimento, ma il nostro journal non è questo
codes.context: Task 4: System provides autocomplete suggestion for journal, but user correctly identifies it as wrong journal

codes.verbatim_quote: quindi creiamo una nuova entity, e il nostro journal è invece Umanistica Digitale, e creiamo una nuova entity
codes.context: Task 4: After rejecting incorrect suggestion, user creates new journal entity with correct title 'Umanistica Digitale'

codes.verbatim_quote: Quindi aggiungiamo il record, lo confermiamo, faccio un rapido check, e mi sembra tutto ok
codes.context: Task 4: Before finalizing, user performs quick self-review of entered metadata to verify correctness

codes.verbatim_quote: e con questo direi che è finita la task 4
codes.context: Task 4: User confidently concludes task completion after verification check

codes.verbatim_quote: The workflow was smooth
codes.context: Written reflection: User describes overall task workflow as smooth and efficient

codes.verbatim_quote: Autocomplete suggestions
codes.context: Written reflection: User identifies autocomplete suggestions as one of most useful features

codes.verbatim_quote: Orcid and other ID integration
codes.context: Written reflection: User appreciates integration with ORCID and other identifier systems as key useful feature

codes.verbatim_quote: I was expecting a search function to look up for articles (which I didn't find)
codes.context: Written reflection: User explicitly mentions expecting search functionality in both audio and non-audio test sessions, consistently not finding it

codes.verbatim_quote: integration with existing catalogues (autocomplete of every field)
codes.context: Written suggestion: User desires integration with external bibliographic catalogs to enable autocomplete for all metadata fields
